question:
Consider the following organisations with their founders:
  1. British India Society - William Adam
  2. Indian National Union - A.O. Hume
  3. National Indian Association - Mary Carpenter
   Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation: British India Society was founded in 1839 in England with the efforts of William Adam, one of the friends of Raja Ram Mohan Roy. In 1885, Allan Octavian Hume secured the Viceroy's approval to create an “Indian National Union”. National Indian Association (NIA) was founded in 1870 by Mary Carpenter in Bristol, with the assistance of Keshab Chandra Sen.
